content:
Non capisco perché passare da Google quando c'è il sito apposito di Libero -> https://aiuto.libero.it/articolo/mail-pec/come-accedere-alla-casella-di-posta-elettronica-certificata-pec/ e -> https://tecnologia.libero.it/come-configurare-libero-mail-pec-41887

Libero Mail PEC con programmi di posta (Client) Puoi gestirla tramite vari programmi di posta elettronica che consentano l’uso dei protocolli: SMTP/S per l’invio, POP3/S e IMAP/S per la ricezione. Le funzioni disponibili sono quelle dello specifico programma di posta utilizzato. Il programma di posta (Client) dovrà essere configurato coi parametri relativi ai servizi IMAP (o POP3) e SMTP su connessione sicura. Parametro (server) per IMAP, POP3 e SMTP (è lo stesso): mail.postacert.it.net – IMAP server: porta 993 – POP3 server: porta 995 – SMTP server: porta 465 IMPORTANTE: nelle Impostazioni Avanzate dell’Account sul programma di posta (Client) devi attivare (selezionare) l’opzione “Il server necessita di una connessione protetta” sia per IMAP che POP3 che per SMTP. Inoltre dovrai verificare il corretto numero delle porte (vedi sopra). Per il server SMTP dovrà inoltre essere scelta l’opzione “Autenticazione del server necessaria”.

content:
I have the folder 863ixu1q.default.

That's your profile folder containing all your data. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data

This folder contains files and folders dating from 2011. I'm guessing that these are not needed and would like to know how to proceed to clean up 863ixu1q.default.

That's exactly right, you're guessing. Usually deleting stuff based on guessing is a silly idea. So unless you know exactly what you're doing, I'd suggest leave those files alone. There may indeed be files not needed anymore, but as long as you don't have any problems I'd not start messing with them.
creator: christ1

creator: positron1

content:
I may have misread it, but the bug is the canonical report. Whilst it remains open it is considered to exist. Personally I see lots of filtering issues related to IMAP that are largely alleviated by changing the action to occur after junk processing as it simply delays the action a little. Most folk these days use IMAP.

I also see more issues from folk using antivirus products other than windows defender and letting them access files in the Thunderbird profile folder at the same time Thunderbird is updating them. File contention is something Thunderbird does not do will with. Generally an exception for the Profile folder will make things much better. This is especially so on unsupported operating systems as the antivirus product tries and compensate for the failure of the operating system to get updates for known issues, making the load from antivirus scanning much greater than it is for most systems (Personally I consider most AV loads unacceptable)

See also https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=378582 which is probably a duplicate that has been around for 16 years.
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: metrorep

content: Unfortunately I have no solution. My best guess what happened is that your calendar data on the exporting computer got corrupted somehow, and that this causes the import on the other computer to fail. Why this happened in the first place, I don't know. The closest I found in Bugzilla is this: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1738611 But I don't think it's the same problem as yours. However, converting a HTML message to an event may have been the trigger. Did you ever do this? So after all, it's possibly a bug in Thunderbird Calendar, and all I can do is to suggest to raise a new Bugzilla bug for your problem. I don't think you mentioned your version of Thunderbird yet, that may also be an important information.
creator: christ1

I also noticed in a few previous help messages other people have the same issue and no one responded like you have to get this fixed. content:
I will try to assist. - one option is to click view>density and set to 'normal' - another option is to click view>fontsize and increase - also, settings>general>fonts and colors sets all views (if you have composition font set to variable-width, which I recommend). At that pane, do the following: - click the 'advanced' tab and set every number to your preferred size. - notice the name at top of the pane. It probably says 'latin' or 'other writing systems' - click the menu and change to the other and set all those numbers to be an EXACT match. When done, latin and other writing systems panes will be identical. Now, if fonts shown are too small, then repeat that process, increasing the number.

I do not recommending rolling back, as you will need to come forward at some point.
creator: davidsk

but, anyway when compositing in a new mail window, we are supposed to be priorized when selecting the email used to send the new one, where in that bug, thund keeps anyway the default one in the general smtp configuration, which is not the expected behaviour, as you can see in screenshot (netc/mailo provider is selected as end user priorised choice, where thund keeps going with the "geeneral default smtp" one (in screenshot, infomaniak), which is not supposed to be..
creator: lm21

content: Edit each SMTP server setting and enter a unique title in the Description field. Then look at account pane for each account and confirm that the identified SMTP server is the correct one for that account. As @sfhowes alluded, it is likely that you are crossing accounts and servers.
creator: davidsk

content:
david a écrit
Edit each SMTP server setting and enter a unique title in the Description field. Then look at account pane for each account and confirm that the identified SMTP server is the correct one for that account. As @sfhowes alluded, it is likely that you are crossing accounts and servers.

unfortunately after a first bug -i guess- I removed all the smtp servers profiles, few weeks ago I didnt noticed I had to rematch emails accounts in their general properties for each, with the smtp profile matching it. (see latest screenshot)

it's now done, thank you, sorry for that

content:
Your post confuses me with words about PDQ and also about Rise Broadband. Is PDQ part of the problem? IS this a POP or IMAP account? I did locate some info of possible use:

input server: securemail.risebroadband.net (for POP: port 995, SSL/TLS - for IMAP: port 993, SSL/TLS) SMTP server: securemail.risebroadband.net port 465 and SSL/TLS - or port 587 and STARTTLS

Is that what you are using?
